content:
Check:
  all:
    # TODO: although we use "exists" here, I get a "Column not found in data" execution error when there is no xxTPTNUM column
    - name: --TPTNUM
      operator: exists
    - name: --TPT
      operator: exists
    - name: --TPTNUM
      operator: non_empty
    - name: --TPT
      operator: non_empty
    - name: --TPTNUM
      operator: is_not_unique_relationship
      value: --TPT
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.290
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: There must be a one-to-one relationship between the values of --TPT and
  --TPTNUM
Outcome:
  Message: The relationship between --TPT and --TPTNUM is not a one-to-one relationship
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '290'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: For each unique planned time point (--TPT), there
                  must be a one-to-one relationship between the values of --TPT and
                  --TPTNUM. Uniqueness for these time points is determined by a combination
                  of the domain, study day, and, if present, category and/or subcategory
                  (--CAT/--SCAT). Other variables, such as --TESTCD and --METHOD,
                  may also be needed in some cases to define uniqueness. When this
                  occurs, clarification should be provided as a comment to --TPTNUM
                  in the define file.
                Document: IG v3.1
                Section: '4.4'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: There must be a one-to-one relationship between the values of --TPT and --TPTNUM

Outcome.Message: The relationship between --TPT and --TPTNUM is not a one-to-one relationship

Citations.Cited_Guidance: For each unique planned time point (--TPT), there must be a one-to-one relationship between the values of --TPT and --TPTNUM. Uniqueness for these time points is determined by a combination of the domain, study day, and, if present, category and/or subcategory (--CAT/--SCAT). Other variables, such as --TESTCD and --METHOD, may also be needed in some cases to define uniqueness. When this occurs, clarification should be provided as a comment to --TPTNUM in the define file.
